sheet.stakes: The attackers are a mercenary company that must cross before winter or face starvation. The defenders are local levies protecting their lord's lands. Honor demands the lord's household troops die before yielding, while mercenary brotherhood means they cannot abandon wounded comrades in the crossing.
sheet.constraints: The defending lord cannot appear weak before his vassals and peasants, yet cannot afford losses that would leave his domain defenseless. The mercenaries cannot retreat without facing certain death, but cannot afford a pyrrhic victory that leaves them too weakened to survive winter campaigns.

side_a.equipment: Mixed professional arms: mail hauberks and coifs, varied swords and axes, crossbows with pavises, some polearms. Equipment shows wear from campaign use but remains serviceable.

side_b.equipment: Militia arms: ash spears, round shields, padded gambesons or leather jerkins, hunting bows, seaxes and farm tools pressed into service. Some mail among sergeants and better-equipped men-at-arms.

terrain_weather.defining_feature: Muddy ford with steep banks on defender side. Woods on attacker's left flank.

features.name: Ford bottleneck
features.description: Muddy crossing allows only 2-3 men abreast with secure footing
features.tactical_impact: Forces attackers into killing funnel, prevents mass assault

features.name: Defensive escarpment
features.description: Steep banks on defender side create 8-foot elevation advantage
features.tactical_impact: Attackers must climb while defenders strike down, negates shield advantage

decision_points.situation: Mercenaries approach ford, face defender positions on high ground
options: Combined frontal assault with flanking maneuver through woods
decision_points.chosen: Combined frontal assault with flanking maneuver
decision_points.rationale: Cannot afford time to find other crossings - winter approaches and supplies dwindling
decision_points.consequences: Commits majority of force to dangerous frontal crossing while detaching 500 men for woods flanking

decision_points.situation: Lead companies take heavy casualties in ford from levy missiles, men hesitating at water's edge
options: Pull back and wait for flanking force
decision_points.rationale: Cannot show weakness to mercenary companies - hesitation breeds mutiny
decision_points.consequences: Mercenaries establish precarious foothold but at terrible cost in the killing ground of the ford

decision_points.situation: Mercenary flanking force emerges from woods behind levy positions, threatens rear
options: Turn half the force to face flankers
Maintain position and fight on two fronts
Conduct fighting withdrawal to secondary positions
decision_points.chosen: Turn half the force to face flankers
decision_points.rationale: Cannot allow rear to be compromised - would collapse entire position
decision_points.consequences: Reduces pressure on ford crossing but creates gap that mercenaries exploit

decision_points.timestamp: As first mercenary formations approach the ford
decision_points.situation: Watching his lead elements take heavy casualties in the bottleneck
decision_points.information_available: Can see the ford is defended, casualties mounting, but cannot assess flanking force progress through woods
decision_points.chosen: Must decide without knowing if flanking force is in position
decision_points.execution_risk: Orders may not reach units already committed to crossing

decision_points.timestamp: When flanking force emerges from woods
decision_points.situation: Suddenly facing attack from behind while committed to defending the ford
decision_points.information_available: Can see immediate threat but unsure of enemy force size or intentions
decision_points.chosen: Must choose instantly without time to assess full situation
decision_points.execution_risk: Levy troops may break if they feel surrounded

casualty_profile.medical_notes: The ford becomes a killing ground. Crossbow bolts punch through mail at close range, creating deep puncture wounds that bleed internally. Men struck while crossing either drown immediately or crawl to shore with contaminated wounds. Those who survive the crossing face cuts and gashes from melee, but it's the bolt wounds that kill - either quickly from severed vessels, or slowly from corruption. In this era, a punctured lung or belly wound is a death sentence. The real slaughter happens in the water where wounded men simply disappear beneath the surface.
